title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the query tab's data set editor page
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, no children node listing is displayed. If a new data set is created without an SQL statement, and the new data source has no database/table/column information, the issue occurs.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. Open the data set editor and navigate to the data source page. 3. Change the data source to one that has no database/table/column information. 4. Observe that no children node listing is displayed. 5. Close the data set editor and reopen it to confirm the issue.
